lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We had a strong showing of Critters that was really amazing from across the world. And Australia. People could fly over from Australia just to get us to sign their books, so there's a lot of really awesome fan love out there. So you guys are great.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Maybe next time all of us could go? You guys should tell them.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh man, a Down Under Kiwi trip for all Critical Role would be a lot of fun. Send your local-- I guess you don't have a congressman, because you're a different country.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Your "Con-gressman."

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh there you go. Orion saved it. Thank you.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Every 50 subs.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: They're awesome.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The fun and interesting challenge for this evening as we've been made aware, you guys, being the ridiculously amazing people you are. One of you crafted a challenge for yourself. That if we can manage to somehow get to 5,000 subscribers before the end of the show tonight, they will create and send an eight-foot Trinket. Like eight-foot-tall Trinket bear.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah which is vague. A little. What's it made out of?

lines.name: ZAC
lines.text: It's a teddy bear. It's a giant teddy bear.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And maybe his little paws can be on my shoulder the whole time I play?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, he would be a perpetual staple of the set. That would be behind you at all times.

lines.name: ZAC
lines.text: Cool, not difficult at all, guys! Totally not difficult at all!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes, but we have to get to 5,000 subscribers.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: They could sneak themselves onto the stage that way.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'll get inside the teddy bear, and I'll act out Trinket during the game. Perfect. That's not going to happen. It might happen. That's if we hit 5000 subscribers, so all your friends you know that watch the show who don't subscribe yet, tell them to. If you know anyone that hasn't seen the show yet, get them on, because a giant eight-foot bear would be pretty much the most ridiculous thing ever.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, I already tweeted #8ftTrinket.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I saw something subs for bears.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Nope. Bad idea.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs) Yeah, subs for bears is a whole section of Craigslist you don't want to go to. Or you do, if that's your thing. All right, so. Happy to be back from Comic Con. We had a great panel and great turnout there. Thank you for those who came and those who watched the panel. If you haven't seen it yet, the panel is available on the Geek and Sundry website. You can watch it. And as we all know, last episode we said goodbye temporarily to our fantastic gnome cleric, Pike. She's off in New York shooting awesome television shows, but she's here in spirit.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's going to be great.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's going to be a good show.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Also, as a reminder, our charity that we run here for the show is to 826LA. 826LA is a fantastic charity that promotes and teaches creative writing to younger kids between the ages of 8 and 16, I think it was. Somewhere in that range?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: K through High School.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: K through High School. Fantastic program, and anything you can do to help is much appreciated and awesome. And, Marisha, if you want to go ahead and take this away. We have a new addition to our set coming next week.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So yeah, that's probably going to be up on our set next week, blessing us with its rose-colored glow. Go watch, if you want to see how we made it. We got this awesome tutorial. It's cool. You can go and learn how to make neon signs yourself.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: And it's all science-y too.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's all science-y. It's totally nerdy awesome. Yeah, krypton. But yes. Here we go. All right, say bye-bye to the sign for now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It'll be back.

lines.name: ZAC
lines.text: It was SonicaMoto.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Congratulations, SonicaMoto.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I think that's pretty likely.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You get nail wraps.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You get a bear behind us for the rest of the show.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You get a player's handbook signed by us.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (laughs) I encourage bear.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: (laughing) I do encourage... Nope. Okay. I am a trained comedian. That is not a thing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We met him at Comic Con.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Put your head right here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A fantastically talented artist. For those of you who have seen my profile picture on Twitter or Facebook, the really amazing artwork of me as a dungeon master, this is the man that did it. Where can they see your work online?

lines.name: JORE
lines.text: I have a Facebook--

lines.name: MARISHA, ORION
lines.text: Drop down.

lines.name: JROE
lines.text: There's a Facebook page. You can search J-O-R-E on Facebook, and that's probably me. If you see Matt's picture, then that's me.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And my Grog raging one with blood covering his face. (growls)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and have a seat.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Speaking of amazing artists. We want to do a shout out.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: There's a couple more announcements. This one.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: This one, yes.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Our wonderful artists. Kit Buss and...

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: They're awesome friends of ours and fans of the show. They do amazing work. They've done a lot of the character work that you've seen, and they're going to be doing a lot more, and we just wanted to really appreciate them and show them some love, so yes. Go follow.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Our artists. As Laura would say.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's good. That's very see-able.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. Is it see-able now? I want to make sure. Go follow them. They deserve it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They've been really amazing. I know many of you have asked about what's the backstory to Vox Machina? What's that history before the stream started? We're working on something. It may take a little bit, but one or more of those artists may be involved. But when we do have that available to you, it should be really cool, and I hope you'll enjoy it. Anyway.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Oh, also, since this is fantasy, I'd like to announce that my show went pretty well that's on Mondays, 7-10 on this channel.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You have a show? What kind of show is it?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Yeah, he's great. So check it out. Every Monday 7-10 on the channel.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There you go. Also all you League fans out there, I hope you're enjoying your new Bilgewater update. Anyone else have any announcements they want to make?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh we're going to be at Otakon this weekend in Baltimore. Come say hi! We're leaving right after this.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm not nearly as funny as Paul Rudd.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Oh pish posh.

lines.name: ZAC
lines.text: Matt? We've got another giveaway.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (singing) Eight-foot Trinket, here we come!

lines.name: ZAC
lines.text: OhGreatLampShade.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: OhGreatLampShade is the winner of our next giveaway.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: OhGreatLampShade, we thank thee for thy mercy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Congratulations. Player's Handbook signed, picture signed, and nail wraps. And a step closer to giant eight-foot Trinket.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Don't do it. No more.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Are you sad that you will no longer be the tallest member of our group?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I feel like we're just delaying starting because we're going to have to face that fact that Pike isn't with us as soon as we start.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And Scanlan's still in the pooper. He's not really.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, where is Scanlan?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: He's shitting on a bed somewhere. It's his thing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Is he on his way?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He's on his way, yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well when he arrives... In the meantime--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Where are you going?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I'm going to get something to drink.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He's getting a drink.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. As Tiberius has an aneurysm and falls to the ground--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yes! I go over and provide very vigorous CPR. No mouth to mouth, just that hand part.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. All right, make a death save.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: And I brought Scanlan with me.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (laughs) Like a trailing fart.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughing) "Like a trailing fart."

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: That couldn't have worked out better.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh really?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What is he wearing?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: "Asp Hole?" What does it say? "Where you" what?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's the Asp Hole.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Asp. Hole.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's just a bar that I like to go to. Down at the Asp Hole.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And I got shit for talking about bears today.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And we'll find it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, we'll find the Asp Hole.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Vasselheim, which is a distant city to the far northwest of the continent they're used to. This city is a very devout, religion-based city, and currently considered the oldest bastion of civilization in the known civilized world. After taking a skyship across the ocean to get there, sealing the Horn, you guys also discover upon doing so that the ruins, long-forgotten ruins, of what appears to be an ancient temple to Sarenrae were recently discovered. While Sarenrae does not have a strong following in this city, the few that are trying to raise it ask for Pike's help to stay back and help build it and bring it to its former glory. Hopefully to re-establish a basis of worship in this city, and she decided to help these folks. The party then steps away from the ruins of the tower, sad but understanding of the circumstance.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Perhaps we could sit on a nearby rooftop and watch Pike work.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Just for the next eight months?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'd be all right with that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's not creepy at all.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: In the haste to make it to the ruin, you've passed out of the section that seems to be under Bahamut's watch and into a different area. In this area, most of the buildings are reinforced with ruddy iron plates. Plumes of smoke rise up from a handful of heavy smokestacks. You can see over the rooftops in the distance toward the center of this section what looks like a massive dark red statue of a muscular bearded man.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The beauty of this game is I have no idea what the shit we're going to do right now.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So we're standing outside the place where we just left Pike?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, the ruins of the tower.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So we're essentially standing in the middle of a town being like, now what?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Should we go look at that statue, then?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I want to see if there's an inscription.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you'd like to.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes, that would be lovely.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: While he's doing that, Scanlan is feeling still terribly sad about leaving Pike. So overcome with emotion that he must step into the ruins one last time, just to see the place where she's going to be for the next several months, years. And before I do so, I drink one of my potions that I bought from what's-his-butt. Gilmore, the glorious Gilmore. Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't know how it works, but I'm going to drink it anyway.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, you drink it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Overcome with a little bit of verklempt emotion, I shed a single tear.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you quietly take this moment to yourself amongst the ruins, you can hear the clattering of stonework as the small band of Sarenrae worshipers are now being helped by Pike, who's gathered them into a plan as to how to remove and restore portions of the building that are currently visible from the dirt and earth that it's embedded in. Hearing her voice echo through the hallway, it's a very comforting sense. You feel a rumbling in your stomach.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I feel uncomfortable. It must be the emotion.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's probably the emotion.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Somewhere where I can have some privacy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You find your way back towards the makeshift wooden plank stairway and there was a small alcove not far from there within the earth wall that looks to be relatively private. There's little to no light, and it does have a view of the current ruin.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I say a little prayer, and I take a big dump on the floor.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughing) No you do not!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, my stomach was rumbling.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughing) You're in a temple, man!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Pike's probably going to have to be the one to clean that up!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (singing) How do I say goodbye to what we almost had?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: This is not romantic at all, you know that, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Welcome back, guys.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I've missed you guys so much.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you finish your business, you step away from the alcove back to the stairway. The contents of the potion seem to have had some effect, as the remnants of what you leave behind have a very soft blue glowing hue to them.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I left a magic dump.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do we need to collect the dump?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Nope. We should leave the dump.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are you going to be able to see through the dump?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: He's covering his face. I think we need the blue shit.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can you cast Detect Magic on the poo?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's already magical poo.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Are we there? We're not there.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're not there. It's just Scanlan.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Okay. So he's just shitting.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He's just leaving it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So I leave and rejoin my fellows, wiping the tear from my eye and the poo from my bottom.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Well, I love you Ashley. I do.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: This is what happens when we don't have any direction.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: But what's the purpose of the potion? To make your poo blue?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I took a potion that will let me see through my poo and check in on Pike from time to time.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Will she realize you can see her through the poop?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I certainly hope not.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wouldn't that be great if she could just talk to you through the poo?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Why aren't the priests going to shovel that shit up?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: As long as some of my cellular remains are there, I might be able to see a little bit into the room.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What's "cellular?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughs) It's poo.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, you mean little flakes of poo.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The clouds overhead begin to slowly rumble and you can hear distant thunder, and you get the feeling due to the moisture in the air, you're not too far away from a rain.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Should we bunk for the night before we head out in the morning?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I say we head to the ship.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Wasn't there a guy with a red beard we were supposed to go see?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I wanted to wander over to the statue while Scanlan was dumping.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I feel great right now, by the way.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Finding some relief in the situation.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Damn it. Just when I was starting to like you, gnome.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Moving on. Let's go take a look at this statue.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (chuckling) All right.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's magic poo!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Don't change, Scanlan.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you guys make your way through the center of this district--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I feel like it's dark now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. You get the sense that this area, most of the people that live in this area are more rough-and-tumble than the already-rough people who live in Vasselheim, from what you've encountered. The buildings themselves all seem to be reinforced with iron plates and it looks like there is a very heavy trade in metalwork, and a lot of the construction of anything metallic appears to be coming through or from this portion of the town. As you approach closer to this statue, it's not just a statue. You see it is actually sitting atop what looks to be a large, blocky fortress-like temple. Unlike the Platinum Sanctuary, which is a very beautiful but simple array, this one has a crenellated top to each of these walled structures. You can see braziers blasting flame every 20 or so feet along the top of it. You can see, as you approach the front of this, there are two giant stone doorways with steps that look up to it and what looks to be two gargantuan war horns that spiral along the sides and then open up outward towards the entire city in front of it. I'm going to ask you guys to make a religion check, if you could.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, I got this.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Natural 20!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah! Natural 20.

lines.name: TALIESIN, ORION
lines.text: Boom!

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: That's so cool.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Natural four.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Because we know our shit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you guys begin your approach, even in the darkness, you can see the figure, this human-like man. Barrel-chested. Massive muscles. What looks almost like iron bracers around his wrists. He is carved or sculpted from solid iron or plates that have been put together from some sort of iron initial structure. The beard is long and goes to about mid-chest. He carries in one hand this long, thick shortsword and has furs and leathers about his legs and midsection. You recognize this to be a very hefty depiction of the deity Kord.

lines.name: LAURA, SAM, TRAVIS
lines.text: Kord?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I admire his beard.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It is a beard worth admiring.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How might one spell Kord?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: K-O-R-D.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Simple. I like that.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He's a god of some sort?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He is, indeed.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Tell us of this Kord. Try to find your notes of this Kord.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He's a dwarven god?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not dwarven.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: A man. Human.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Kord is essentially a deity of warfare, combat, and storms. A god that has been long-worshipped by tribal cultures from long past that enjoyed the essence of battle and challenge and combat.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Did you say storms, Tiberius? War and combat and storms?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Storms, yes. Storms and winds.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And quickly, the motif of this section of the town comes into play. This, you assume, is the portion of the city that is dedicated to the temple of Kord, this being the structure before you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Does it seem to be a central theme across the whole town? This town worships Kord?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The first one you were brought to was primarily under the worship of Bahamut, the Platinum Dragon.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. (giggles)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Getting the giggles out.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Did you look at it? Did you use your fancy eyes to look at it?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, my question is, is this a temple? If it is a temple to Kord, is this a place of battle? Is this somewhere where people go watch battles and fighting?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: From the exterior, and it is a closed-off temple, it looks like a large, blocky, obstinate fortress that is nearly impenetrable from the way it's constructed and reinforced. You don't know what's inside of it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: There's a big gate or door at the front?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Two large iron doors about 20 feet tall that are currently shut. It's about five or six steps getting up to it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And it's nighttime?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It is nighttime currently, yes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Are there any citizens out right now, or are we alone in the dark?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As it has gotten to dusk, it's thinned out a little bit, but there are a few individuals walking by, carrying pickaxes over one shoulder and passing by.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'd like to walk over to the nearest one and ask.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: To who?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: To a passerby.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The two gentlemen, one's in his mid-20s. The one that turns to you initially probably looks a little older than that. Late 30s, grizzled. Shaven, but the five-o'clock shadow has definitely kicked in. Longer, tousled hair, dirt on the face. Simple clothing, pickaxe over his shoulder and what looks like a leather belt that carries other tools.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: These are dwarves?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: These are human. "Yes? I heard you calling."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Excuse me, good sir. My friend over here, the dragonborn. He seems to think that this is some sort of temple or edifice to the god Kord. I just want to know, is he correct?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Is this your first time in the Braving Grounds?"

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: In Dwarvish, I say--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: They're not dwarves.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes, absolutely! This is our first time. We literally just rolled into Vasselheim. What can you tell us of this? It's an impressive structure.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The younger gentleman next to him, similarly dressed, begins to speak up. He puts his hand up and goes, "The Braving Grounds is the area of this city that is built around the worship of the great "god Kord. His protection and strength he bestows upon those who live for the sake of challenge. To "prove oneself better with each passing day, that is the basis of the Braving Grounds."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So it's like a battleground?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "What you see before you--" He looks up at the giant structure. "This "is called the Trial Forge. It is the oldest known temple to Kord and has been built and rebuilt for "many, many hundreds of years."

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: (chuckles) Hence forge, right?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And does one need to be a priest or cleric of this faith to challenge oneself? Or can anyone--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Worship?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Anyone is able to worship what deity they wish in this town. We have an understanding. If "you're looking for a tussle, what you're looking for is the Crucible."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yes. What else can you tell us about this Crucible?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you're looking to just get your fight on and "punch someone in the face, the Crucible is what you're looking for." He spits off to the side and points a little ways down the roadway.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I think Grog wants to go.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Beyond that way, you'll see a tavern known as the Bellows' Respite."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Bellows' Respite.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "One of the finer inns you'll find in the Braving Grounds proper, but I take it if you walk "that direction, you'll see the Crucible before too long."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Have you ever fought in the Crucible?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I'll just stick to the mines."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Are these battles to the death?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Nah. These are battles of honor. Death belongs in a true war. Mind you, there have been "some folks unfortunately who may have fallen to a hit on the head too hard, and that's "understandable. But the purpose of Kord is not necessarily to smite your foes unless they've "given you damn good reason. Other than that, contest of strength is how we live."

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: A friendly sparring match is what we're about.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's this neighborhood of Vasselheim, not the city as a whole, just in these parts?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Pardon my friend. He's clumsy." And the other gentleman picks up his tools and is like, "Sorry."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Have you been to this Crucible often, and if so, is there a champion or a favorite that you've seen or know of?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Probably best to ask around the Crucible, to be "honest. I've seen some people take some serious beatings down there. I haven't kept much attention "to it. I haven't the money to sling around it."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The money? Wait, it costs money?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "What, you think there's going to be fights in a pit and no one's betting on it? Welcome to "Vasselheim, my dear."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We're going to be rich!

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: What if there are two people fighting the town does not know?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I don't know. Take it up at the Crucible."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: How far is the Crucible from here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Keep walking. You'll see it."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Keep walking? Thank you, friend.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "My pleasure. Kord's strength to you." And he keeps on walking.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Kord's strength.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Kord's strength to you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, core strength.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Sit-ups. Crunches.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Core strength to you. Namaste.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys walk beyond the Trial Forge, back towards the path where you came off to the side on the left and you can see most of the buildings, their internal lighting is very low; you can see most folks either go to bed at this evening or at least keep a very low visual profile from their abodes. However, lights are blazing from the interior of this three-story inn. The Bellows' Respite is definitely a rowdy place. You can hear already the shouts and music streaming from the interior of it. You gather that, while there are a lot of people inside you can see at the windows and openings to the inside of the tavern, there is a large group gathered in the middle of the thoroughfare just outside of it. Looks like a circle of individuals that are all shouting and screaming over each other, big fist-pumps to the air, some folks are angrily throwing their coin purses to the ground.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Like a kid getting too close to an amusement park, I take off running.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Grog starts running up, bounding up the way, you can see the actual--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Grog? Grog, not too far ahead!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Okay!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't start running, but I'm following behind him and I take out my Keen Dagger and just start sort of dancing it across my hand as I follow after him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: David Bowie and the glass orb.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes, exactly.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Is there a registry or something like that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Actually, as you approach you can see there is no registry, there is quite literally a pit in the ground. It's a 15, 20-foot dip. It is a carved-out pit, maybe no more than I'd say 25, 30 feet across. And there is no ladder, there is no step going down, there's just two people in there beating the ever-living crap out of each other and a crowd of people gathering around. You do see what looks to be two very well-dressed gentlemen that are in the process of collecting and paying out, and you approach just as the final hit takes to this gentleman's jaw, this tattooed individual, you can see bloodied in the face, nose broken, teeth knocked out, this poor, poor human fellow gets knocked clean onto the ground. You can see standing over his body this extremely built, aggressive, looks like another human female with her hair pulled back in a very tight ponytail just spits on his body, turns around and wipes the blood from the front of her face. Snaps her fingers, and you can see folks bring a ladder and lean it over the side and she climbs up the ladder as everyone cheers on her way up.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Before we get up to the crowd, I transform into Minxie. I'm going Minxie. And I catch up to Grog. Going Minxie.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, they don't like magic.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Did they see me? I'm trying to do it stealthily before it happens.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do know through the discussions that it's arcane magic that seems to be the shunned element in this town. As it is a town of worship, divine magic for the most part seems okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Everyone saw me. It's fine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Everyone would've seen you if they weren't currently enraptured by the chaos. Those who did notice probably didn't seem to care much other than a giant tiger now walks up to them.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I grab the nearest person near me, turn whoever's shoulder that is, and go, who is she?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Are you new to this town, then, is it?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, very new.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That's the Siren. The Siren."

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I approach and saunter next to Grog.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The Siren?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "She's the one you bet on. Trust me on that." As he walks over to, you can see another one of these gentlemen, very well-dressed, hair slicked back. Tall, thin human in very, very fine purple robes, collects some people's money, begins giving out a few things, pulls out a notebook with a little charter he's in the middle of putting notes in.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hello. How would we enter a new fighter into this pit?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, actually, that was the last fighter scheduled for the evening."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Be a pity not to have one more.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You wish to fight?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Wish? It's more like an itch. A need.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He puts his arm out and the crowd steps back a bit and he takes a good, long head-to-toe up-and-down look at you, walks around from side to side inspecting you. He gets a little bit close and reaches out, not even asking, he starts grabbing the side of your arms.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I start growling a little bit.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh yeah, watch out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, it's not too late. What caliber of fighter "do you consider yourself?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Caliber?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Who do you want to fight?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Who are the options?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Could he fight anyone?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: This is my friend, Scanlan.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm more of his manager than his friend, actually. Hi, I'm Scanlan.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Pleasure."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Pleasure's all mine. My brute over here, who can he battle, what are his options?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "This late in the evening--"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'll fight him.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Excuse me?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I said I'll fight him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I apologize. If you're going to have someone enter the arena worth betting on, they "have to go up against one of our proven fighters first. However, once your friend here gets his "face beaten in, you're more than welcome to join him in the ring thereafter."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I haven't laughed so hard in my entire life. Face beaten, he says. Face beaten!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You're mighty confident, aren't you?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: If I did.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It would be that.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, first and foremost, all bets begin at 100 gold pieces."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 100 gold? Is that all?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You can increase the bet, if you'd like."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'd love to.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "What would you like to bet?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 500 gold on this one right here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Is she the only one betting?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: She bets for all of us.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'll put a thousand down right now that I can beat the big guy.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You mean Grog?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Of my own money. Yes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You can't fight him yet!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I can't? Rules are meant to be bent and stretched. Am I right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You're going to put your money down between your friends to fight your friends."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's a contentious relationship.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: His eyes have already wandered from your face, he says, "500 gold on the goliath. Do we "hear anything else?" A few other individuals step up and start telling him like, "50 gold down." "It's a hundred-gold minimum." "100 gold."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Who is he fighting?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We don't know yet.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We have to bet before we see the meat?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Unproven fighters with a grandiose sense of self-ability enjoy the surprise."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: So what sort of odds are we talking about, then?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "For this one, based on your height, reach, strength and arrogance, "I'd put you at four-to-one against."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Four-to-one.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: It's okay, Grog. He doesn't know that you've beaten up a lot of people.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Don't tell him.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Oh, right.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I've got this scar here. How does he think I got it?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Those are fair odds, we'll take that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All right. 500 gold. Is this all I'm hearing?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: A hundred of my own gold on me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "600 gold."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Hold on.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll bet 50 gold against him. We have to hedge!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "100 gold is the minimum bet."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well then, I can't afford it. I'm sorry. We have to hedge.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You're going to get it, Grog. You're going to do it. I have faith in you.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I'll put 500 gold on the goliath.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh my god. We're going to lose all our money on Grog. No we're not.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All right. Last bets, last bets!" Everyone starts putting in their cash. A couple folks frenzy over, you see a couple guys--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I put a thousand on the goliath.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: 1,000 gold on the goliath.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Sing a song. Do you use arcane magic or do you use divine magic? Just sing a song, Scanlan.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It seems your friends are confident in your ability. Let's hope we can put their money where "your mouth is."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: In my mouth?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's an expression.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All right."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I brush against Grog. And I cast Stoneskin on him.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Will that show?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Does that show?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You cannot cast a spell when you're in beast form.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Plus, kitty, you did that once and it didn't work out so well.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: As I notice what the cat's doing, I'm standing right next to him, so I do it with my hand instead.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You got caught with your hand in the cookie jar.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you begin casting the spell, immediately the guy says, "You do that one more time and "you're all disqualified from ever competing."

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Okay. I'm sorry, I just thought I'd give my friend an advantage.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: He'll be fine. Look at him. He'll be fine.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Yes, I have two eyes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yes. Retrieve him, please."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Him?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "For this fight, we have a newcomer. A newcomer who is named--"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Should I have a fancy name?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, you should have a fancy fighting name.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Grog the Destroyer.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: No, that's like the opposite of what I said.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Phillip, the newcomer, has decided to hedge his and his friends' savings that he, upon what I "can only imagine is his first arrival into Vasselheim, to get his face pummeled by our "current standing champion: Kern the Hammer." At this point, the crowd immediately goes quiet and whispering, you can see a few individuals now walking over, ushering this man, looks like he just stepped out of the nearby mines, he's got coal dirt on his face. When I say man, it is a six-foot-six, very visibly half-orc gentleman, built like some sort of thick-ass building you've walked past coming through here. Bald head, big, bristly mustache, and a face that's obviously taken a beating over the years. He walks up nonchalantly, just wearing a simple tattered tunic, leather pants and boots. You can see him like cracking his fingers. He looks over to the side at one of the guys. "They better have pulled "me out of work for a good reason. Who am I up against?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I envy your facial hair.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Currently."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm going to kill him. That's a rule, right? I'm not supposed to kill him?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You're not supposed to kill him. No killing allowed in this?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Fighting until one falls."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What happens if they start to cry?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Then you keep punching."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I like it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "No weapons. No armor. Fists against fists until one of them falls. Lower the ladder." As they put the ladder down into the arena. You can see the orc gentleman pulls out a small, enclosed, almost like a wineskin, like an iron wineskin, unscrews it and drinks it all down.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Kern the Shithead does?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. Puts it down, throws it to the ground, with a ting-ting-ting.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wait, what was in that? Was that wine?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It is customary to drink before a fight."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I have my cask of ale, real fast?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wait, does anybody have a Potion of Stoneskin or anything good?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As everyone gathers around, you can now see people are coming back out of the tavern to gather around the outskirts of the Crucible. Grog gets lowered down the ladder.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, he's already down?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, Grog, what else do you want to do before you prepare?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What do I want to do to prepare?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, if you haven't gone down yet. The other guy has come down the ladder.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I took a drink from the cask of ale--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't know if I hand it to him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a stealth check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. (squeaks) Nope.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What did you roll?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, that's a six. So eight.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. As you walk towards him and begin looking in his eyes, as you begin to pull out the flask, a hand grasps your wrist. And you glance over and you can see one of the burly human gentlemen that escorted Kern the Hammer in is currently grasping your arm and says, "I'm "watching you. One more try and I'll throw you in there. We'll go down ourselves."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's for my asthma. I promise.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Looks to you, Grog, up into your eyes. "You going "to climb down and fight or you going to be a pussy about it?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's a really good question. I would like to rage. And I jump in the fucking pit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You leap over the side, completely avoiding the ladder, both feet hitting the ground with a heavy thud sound. The packed dust kicks up around your feet.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Come on, Phillip! Kick his ass!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At which point, the other orc's finished cracking his knuckles, just kind of wipes the spit off the edge of his chin, gives you a look (growls) and you see a bit of foam toss from the side of his mouth.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Nobody fucks with Phil.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I can smell you from here, Kern!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and roll initiative.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 20! All righty.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Oh shit, you got a 20?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: First round starts. You're up.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I would like to cast Intimidating Presence on Fern the Fucknut.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Kern. But it's better if Grog gets it wrong.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: He never gets it right. Phillip, thank you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Phillip. All right, so. Use your action to use Intimidating Presence? All right, so what's the DC on that?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Saving throw, 13.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 13. That will unfortunately not succeed. As you glare at him with an angry Phillip glare, your bellow echoing through the bottom of this Crucible, which in itself forms a very interesting acoustic amplifying of your yell, you can see Kern on the other side is looking at you with the same intense, burning rage.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wait, that's your whole move?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And you can move if you like.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll let him come to me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. All right. So as you stand there waiting with fists at your side, Kern takes his turn. You can see he begins to circle a little bit around you as he begins to spiral about with an unnerving speed, dashes forward, fists come swinging, one, two. Both strikes coming towards you. That is a 19.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Misses.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is all fisticuffs. That is a 24.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That hits.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And as a bonus action, using his rage, a third attack. That is a 21.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That definitely hits.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Would you like to use my spiky die?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Don't do it. You got this, Phillip.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The second one does seven points of damage. As one fist clips you across the chin, the other one goes right into your abdominals. You're still tensing and you feel the impact but you just take the sheer weight of the force and flex and angrily stare him down in return.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Phillip, do that thing where you move your pecs up and down! (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's going to be a gif. And as you now see Kern prepares for a second bout, it's your turn, Grog. What are you doing?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I would like to go into a frenzied rage. I would like to start with a giant front-kick forward and then hammer him down.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Go for the first strike.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Shit, that misses. Two.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's probably going to miss.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yep. That's a 19.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 19 is going to hit.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And also 19.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and roll damage.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That is a 16.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So rolling 1d4 and then half that.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Half that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You only get half damage of a d4?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yep. But you still add your strength modifier.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So these guys both potentially have like a hundred hit points.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Six. It was four, and then half of that is two, plus my modifier, which is four, so six.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct, so six damage. All righty.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And then four.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: This is what I use? For my fists? I got big-ass fists! I got tattoos and shit on them. I never shower, they fucking stink!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You could do more damage if you hit him with the die, because it's sharp, so you'd actually get more damage with the d4.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. So your modifier is plus-- it's plus three for the modifier?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, my modifier's plus four.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, and then what did you roll on that?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Two. Minus two.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Two, then five total.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, five, yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There you go. All righty, cool. So you hit him across the face and you hit him to the other side. He comes back, aligns his chin, and you can see he's now stooping in for some sort of an uppercut as he slips to the side a little bit with a sidestep. That will be a 25. A 20. And a one. So what's your AC?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's now your go.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No one fucks with Phillip Jr. I would like to bull rush and try and tackle him, and if it succeeds, I'd like to headbutt him on the ground.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, okay. It's an action to do that, so you can use your bonus action to attempt--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And I would only get two attacks, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's an action to grapple.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So go ahead and roll an athletics check.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, that's even better. 22.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 22. Yeah, you slam into him, knock him to the ground, and you're now on top of him. He's currently considered grappled, and you can go ahead and attempt your headbutt.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Say hi! (boosh) That's a lot. 24.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 24? Yeah, definitely. So go ahead and roll damage on the same 1d4.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: 1d4? It's my head!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yep.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Your head is so puny.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh. One and a half plus my strength, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He's going to reach up and grab you and attempt to headbutt you in return.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I like it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's your go.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I would like to keep his head right where I have it and take my elbow and drive it down into the bridge of his nose. So that's 25?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 25 hits.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hits.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And 17.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 17 does miss. All right. So go ahead and roll damage for the next two strikes.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: With this thing again? Six.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Six, all righty.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's hard to get above a six. And six.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You go down for the third one, and this time he reaches up and grabs your elbow. He's going to take his turn to attempt to break your grapple as his action. Go ahead and roll either an athletics or an acrobatics check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 12? All right. He kicks you up back onto your feet, and as he does, he kip-ups onto his feet, as well. Looks at you with a smile, wipes the snot and blood from the front of his face, licks it off his hand, and with that same hand he rears back, almost like he's winding up for a punch, and then just kicks you right in the center of your stomach.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I like the feint, I like the feint.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's 22. Yeah, that'll hit. That is eight points of damage.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: He's fucking strong.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You suck, Korn!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're both now standing face-to-face again, you're reeling from the kick to the breadbasket.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You hit me with the knuckle you fucking licked. So I'd like to jump forward and throw my knee forward and at the last minute pull it back and throw my fist in a Superman punch.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, go ahead and roll.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yes, fuck you, 19.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 19 just barely hits.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (boom, boom)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go for it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are you still raging?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: 21. Oh yeah, frenzied, so I get three. And 22.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All hit.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Outstanding. Watch me roll a six.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (whispers) Should we do something?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Have an ale. And collect the money.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I feel like we should do something.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: 16, total.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nice. (whack, whack) You first jumped, hit him in the face. As he stumbles backward, use the inertia to slam him again with the same fist in the face and then turn around with a full-on haymaker to the side of the temple. (whack) As you can see, there's a spray of blood and spittle across the, you guys are starting to push towards the back wall of the Crucible, and he actually staggers back a little bit towards the wall from the impact. (cackles) And he charges towards you, putting his head right towards the stomach that he kicked before, going for that same soft spot he's opened for himself. That's going to be a 20. Yeah, that hits. 21. And 21. Comes in, slams you into the middle of your abdomen for seven damage.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Should I sing?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So that'd be 15, 22 points of damage. As he slams his head into your midsection, picks you up over his head, slams you onto the ground, and as you're on the ground, he runs up and soccer-ball kicks you in the side of your ribs, just (whack). You hear a crack as the impact hits and you can feel that surging, shooting, burning pain begin to fill the side of your torso. It's your go.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What else do I have? What can I do?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You can throw some dirt in his face!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm so sorry.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and make a deception check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Was he pointing at you?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh god.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He looks down at you and looks over at the elf and he says, "I'll deal with him after the "fight. I've got too much money on this right now."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What an asp-hole.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I roll up off of my side and I start to go, oh, I don't know, it might be too much. And I grab a handful of dirt and I throw it up into his face.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Riki-oh style. I like it. All right. So. As you go ahead, go ahead and just roll a basic attack.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Fuck. Thank you, god. 26.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 26. Make a dexterity save on his end-- no, that won't work. So you throw the dirt up. As he's rushing towards you to follow up on the attack, the dirt goes streaming into his eyes and for a second he stumbles and starts trying to wipe his face. As he does, he has the blood on his hands that's also getting in his eyes, the blood's starting to cake up a bit, and he's just reaching out in the area. So that's your first attack.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and roll an attack. You have advantage on this currently, because he can't see it coming.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's even better! 25.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 25. Go ahead and roll damage.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh no, I only have two, right? Ten.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How was that ten, baby? That was 11. The first one was a five.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Halved. Six.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's 11.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Baby!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you're going to do grundle damage. So as he's reeling and tries to reach out, swiping a back-fist into open air, you rush up and (whack) hit him with sheer force that you hear a unanimous (groans) in the crowd all around echo down. His knees immediately bend in towards each other, and you can see the sound escape instinctively from him, it's like, (wheezes). As you reel for your second strike, which is going to be? What's the second one you do?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, did he drop to his knees?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, he's still standing, but barely.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, really? Yeah, same place.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You pull back and (whack) a second time in the same spot, this sending him onto the ground from behind. He is currently prone. Okay, that's rough.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're going to need a scouting party to find where one of them went. So at the top of his turn, gets up and wipes dirt crust from his eyes, reeling from the impact. Uses half his movement to get up and staggers toward you as you're just welcoming it. Looks up at you for a second and says, "You shouldn't have done that, tall guy." At which point, he goes and lunges for your midsection a second time. Misses with that strike, as you dodge out of the way he spins around and attempts to back-kick you to the torso. That will hit. A 26. And that one is going to-- That's going to be six points of damage to you from the back-kick, and as his foot comes down, he's still reaching for his groin from the sheer pain, he just rushes forward and attempts to bite into your shoulder. That's going to be a 20.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: He rolled a 20?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not a natural 20. Just a total of 20. He's rolled a lot of 20s. That's going to be seven damage as he sinks his teeth into the side of your shoulder and neck area. And tears a chunk of your flesh out of the sides of his mouth, now, in the muscle. So you reel back in pain and you're both clutched in this gladiatorial grip. It's your go.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, amazing. Since we're clutched in that grip, I'll grab him back and I'm going to try and bite his nose off.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wait, doesn't he have no nose?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, he's missing a hollow, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's mashed in.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: How about I just aim for this area and if I catch lip I'll take it as a victory.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Go ahead and roll.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yes! Okay, 21.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That hits.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All hit. So as you reach forward, you use the yell of pain to turn it into an attack, reach forward and bite into the front of his face. You don't get any nose, but you do catch the top of his lip. As you pull back with a snapping sound, part of his upper lip just comes off in your mouth. How much damage does that do?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's a souvenir.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The first one is six.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Six damage. All right. What's your follow-up attack?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Would you say that he reaches back for his face like that in pain?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh yeah, he rears up with his hand right there and is like, (yelps).

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Fantastic. I'd like to just drive my fist into his throat as his head's arched back.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, go ahead and roll damage on that.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yes! Five.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Five, all right.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You know what I love about these fights? They're beautiful. The beauty of the human body.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And what's your third strike?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Would you say that he bends forward, then, because he's grabbing his throat like that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He's tough. He's bending forward, but he's not completely incapacitated. He's in pain.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Right, I would say I go up next to him and invoke a fabled hero that I heard about in the woods named Macho Man Randy Savage, and I double-tap my elbow and drive it down on top of his head.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs) All right. Go ahead and roll damage on this one.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Thank you. Six.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Six. So as you leap up, using the goliath weight coming down, you double-tap the elbow and you bring it down on top of his head. He, from the sheer force of it (wham) slams down face-first into the dirt, just like that. Onto the ground. As he's getting up, he's looking kind of rough.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I believe that's pronounced Ma-choman Rand'Savage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There you are. A gracious warrior of the woods. While on the ground, he reaches forward and attempts to sweep your legs out from under you. Go ahead and make-- this would be an acrobatics-- no, we'll make this a dexterity saving throw. Why not?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Ten.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's going to be a 22.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 22 to hit. You take six points of damage.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, good. (laughs) I was thinking 22 points of damage!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Where are you at, hit point-wise?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I say, tastes like home. And I spit in his face and reach up and thunderclap both of his ears.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs) All right, go ahead and roll for attack.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hits.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 17 does not hit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 22 does hit. So you reach up. Go ahead and roll damage.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh yeah, right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (whack) Thunderclap to the side of both his ears.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Six.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Six points of damage. As he rears back and instinctively his hands go up and try and grab at your wrists, you pull the wrists back, and he's holding you from that point. You attempt to go for another strike, but he just redirects it with his own arms. You manage to pull out of the grip with a third strike. What are you doing for that one?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: He pulled away from my wrists, and I'll give him a little of the same. Put my fists together and just swing straight down into his solar plexus since he's sitting on top of me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Roll damage.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's a five.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Five. (wham) You hit and you hear the wind out of him from the impact, (wheezes) and he's trying to get the wind back.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I can't hear you. What?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He pushes off of your chest to stand up for a second and (gasps) gets one big inhale of air, and as he does, he reaches up his leg and then tries to curb-stomp kick you right in the stomach while you're still on the ground. That will be 18.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Misses!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. A 19.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Misses!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And that will be a 24.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You son of a bitch!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. So he goes to kick you once, and you dodge out of the way. Kick a second time. This time, you catch the foot and hold it in place. He then lifts up with his other foot to a point where now you're holding him in the air. As he puts all of his weight in the air, he comes down and slams his elbow right into the center of your chest, in the way you did to his head earlier. That's going to be for a total of eight points of damage.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I take the flagon of ale that I've been drinking all this time. I slam it down on the ground and push my sister out of the way and yell at the top of my lungs, Grog! Your father was an undead piece of shit and your cousin's going to make you his bitch!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There's not enough popcorn in the world for this.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I know.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (growls) I would like to reach forward with both of my thumbs and shove them into his fucking eye sockets.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Roll an attack.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Fuck!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, no. You distracted him.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: 12. That's better. 22.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so as you reach up to try to get his eyes, he grasps your hands and instead begins pulling back on the wrists. You can feel the tension of the bone beginning to bend from the sheer strength and force of it. As you pull back your arms, you attempt to headbutt him again and he dodges his head out of the way, and he knows he has you at an advantageous position. What do you want the third attack to be?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: He's still on top of me, isn't he?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. Where are you at hit point-wise, by the way?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He's looking pretty rough, too. So what do you want the third attack to be?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Would you say he's on my chest?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He's currently on your chest and waist area right now, like (grunts) holding you down.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I was going to grapple him, but if he's on my chest, I'll use my thighs to shove him up towards the upper part of my body and I'll drive down my elbow at the same time. Into that whole bloody target area.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs) Okay. As you shift upward, you bring your elbow forward. Roll for attack.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, he rolled three already.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, that's right.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I got at least a six.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So six damage? Okay, as you position him up, (whack) the elbow hits, and you can feel it sink in. What bones are there are mostly splintered and broken, and you get a good inch into his face with your elbow. As you pull back, he's looking really rough, and one of his eyes is beginning to swell entirely shut.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We look like a Rocky movie right now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. This is a full-on, drag-out fight.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I must break you!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He angrily looks down at you, (snarls) and he reaches both of his hands up again in a giant hammer fashion. That's going to be a 17?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Misses.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Hits.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And a 15.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Misses!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The second hit comes down and slams you for eight points of damage. (wham) This one, you can feel the sternum crack. As he brings up his fists a third time, attempting to end this, you use the leverage you had when you pushed him up to actually spring your entire body upward and force him off you. He manages to get to his feet and you just get up and you both are bleeding from all over your faces with giant bruises, and both of you are barely holding yourselves up, breathing heavily. It's your go.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm going to rush at him, spit on my knuckles, swing back, and at the last second, take my right foot and drive it right through his kneecap.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Roll for attack.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Fuck you! Yes! 24.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 24 hits.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Roll damage.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Come on, roll good.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Five. Six. Six.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, and what are the attacks you do?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I want to drive my foot through his kneecap.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It snaps. He's still standing on the other leg, but the knee is cracked behind.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, that's amazing. I'll just put my foot through his other knee.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you jump off the other one, (whack) it catches the knee. It doesn't snap, but you can see there is a bend to it, and then he falls to the ground, on both of his busted knees now, looking up at you. And with the third strike, what are you going to do?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I would like to grab his head, since he's probably kneeling on the ground at this point, right? And say, there's only room for one to rage in this pit. And I take it, and I just smash into the top of his jaw, hopefully dislocating the bloody, lipless face that I see.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Wait, is he an orc?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He's a half-orc.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: As a half-orc, does he got those big teeth?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There are little tusks there, yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll grab onto those.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They're small to pull. You slam down on his face. (crunch) You can see the jaw crack open. The tongue instinctively moves around a little, but the jaw is definitely broken from the impact.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's like a dance! It's like a beautiful dance.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can see, that blow should have taken him out, because there was nothing left.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: He's like the Black Knight in Monty Python! He's got no knees!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Reaches up and grabs you by the throat and brings you up to slam into his head. This is going to be a 21. A 17.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Miss.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: With a resounding crack Grog's head spins, his body turning. He stumbles a couple of steps, falls to one knee, face-down in the dirt, unconscious. The whole crowd raises and cheers, (cheering) as the mostly broken half-orc raises one of its fists to the air, walks around, looks over to your body, reaches into his pocket and flicks a gold coin onto your back. Walks over to the ladder and begins very painfully making his way up to the edge of the Crucible.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, he's only using his arms because he's got no knees! Douche.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Getting up to the top, the crowd cheers. You can now see one of the bookies reveals a holy symbol, one that you recognize as the symbol of Kord, and he goes down and immediately begins administering, healing to our recently unconscious Grog. You can see the other bookie, who is dressed similarly in the purplish robes you saw before, also begins to heal our good fighting half-orc friend as he lumps over and takes his sack of coins from him. The clerics of Kord are the ones actually running this, it looks like. You come to in the pit, Grog, beaten, wearied, and fatigued because of your frenzied rage. However, you have been defeated in the Crucible.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That was painful.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That was so close.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I go down and nurse him, nurse his head, hold him, and just tell him, Grog, you won! You did it, buddy!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a deception roll.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I would say given the circumstances, it's nice that he's trying, but it's been a while since you've been bested in one-on-one combat, and a part of you is deeply hurt by it. But at the same time, there is that burning fire, that need to come back and vengefully tear him down from his precipice when you're ready.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I say nothing.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: It's okay, buddy. This isn't the first time you've been knocked unconscious.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That would've been great.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I go up and rub on him and (meows).

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you're being tended to by your party, the same bookie that brought you in comes over and taps you on the shoulder and says, "Not going to lie, no one has taken a beating from the Hammer "like that and brought him so close. I don't think he's going to be able to take another round with "you for at least a few days. But you're welcome to fight in my ring any time you wish."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We'll need to earn our money back.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "There is that, yes."

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Or you could just give it to us.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I walk away.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is there a whorehouse here in Vasselheim?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: You're asking this question?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A curious laugh comes across the bookie's face and he says, "The third floor of the Bellows'--" What did I call it, again?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The Bellows' Respite.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The Bellows' Respite. Sorry, I was in the moment. "The third floor of the Bellows' Respite "does itself run as a brothel, if that's what you're inquiring."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That is what I was inquiring.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Come on, Grog, we'll get you ice cream.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How's that sound?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Coldstone?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Grog, you can eat the ice cream from the whore.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Tiberius, really?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I'm trying to be creative here. Make him feel good. Fireworks. Prestidigitation.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Grog, as you make your way into the tavern, there is, though in your solemn state you can see a number of the patrons who were watching from the inside who were part of the crowd all give a round of applause to you as you enter. The barkeep who turns to you, a human fellow who's missing one eye, has a tufted, spotty beard and happily extends a large tankard of ale and says, "On the house for you, friend! You fought well tonight."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I like your beard.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I take five of my remaining gold and slide it over to that bartender and say, just keep it coming. All night, please. Thanks.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I'll deliver it to the room. By the way, what room are you staying in?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do we have a room?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We would love one of those.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The third floor, I believe.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: For some of us, not all of us.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: partake tonight.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Might have problems.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Aw, he's chugging. He's sadness-chugging.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "The rest of you, how many rooms you taking? Three amongst you?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Three.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Three rooms for the night."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Plus a stable for our bear.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No. Our bear will stay in the room with us girls.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It looked like rain, right? I'll be out there with the pigs.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, Grog.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, it's okay, he needs to stew in this for a while.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Your room's on the house, friend. The rest of you, that'll be six gold for the evening."

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I'll stay in your room, Grog.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't think he wants company tonight.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: No, he can sleep with the pigs. I'll stay in the free room.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So that's six gold for them. All right, so mark off your losses for the money you put in for the pot.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Where do I mark off my loss of pride?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That would be under additional notes.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I almost won.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Damn it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Almost.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What did he have, that orc piece of shit, he had what that made him come back?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They can only do it once per day.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: He had one left?!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You brought him to negative five on that final hit, but that half-orc racial ability...

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's even worse!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Grog, if it's any consolation--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What's that mean?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's a grouping of stars in the sky.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: As I had no idea that weapons weren't allowed in there, if you and I had fought, you would've beaten me to a bloody paste.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: There's a lot of injured pride tonight.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can we just sleep?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I found it to be very entertaining.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Hey, does anyone want to come to my room and look through my shit to see how Pike's doing?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, yeah!

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Let's look through your shit. Scanlan.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Pike would have been proud of you, Grog.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Thank you. And if there had been weapons I'd be in deep shit. I'll be at the bar.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, Grog, come on.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And yet it doesn't stop him as he, bite by bite, makes his way through the piece of driftwood he found by the bar.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I slap down another five gold to the bartender and say, that's for that barstool.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Thank you." Which, the barstools, by the way, have a thick, crusty wool on them, so there's a unique flavor to the piece you've chewed through.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The frying on this chicken is exquisite.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And with that, we're going to take a quick break, but we'll be back here in about ten minutes, guys, right after Overlord has a few.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Fuck!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He's so upset. He's really upset.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I've never seen him this upset.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Yeah, isn't it weird when other people get upset?

lines.name: ZAC
lines.text: We'll figure it out somehow. He will buy that for us and ship it to us, it's a very, very generous thing to help get us to 5,000 subscribers, and I was told from some people in the chat that I should also contribute in some way, shape, or form, so I have agreed to dress up as Pengulord tomorrow all day if we reach this goal. And for those who don't know, there was a very large war this morning in team No Stream, the chatroom, while we were offline. Someone thought it would be funny to put my face on a penguin. I did not think it was funny, and I timed out and banned every single person that referenced it, and exalted all of my power as Overlord, so it pains me to agree to do this, very much so, because it completely diminishes everything I've strived so hard for in world domination. Penguins are the least-threatening animals on the planet, and I despise them.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Wow, that is an intensity. Pengulord, guys.

lines.name: ZAC
lines.text: Good for you guys.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Pengulord, I like the sound of that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: They like to snuggle.

lines.name: ZAC
lines.text: Well, good for them. No.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We could fit Pengulord on a license plate, right?

lines.name: ZAC
lines.text: No. Too many letters.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: If we get you in this outfit, will you waddle? That's really the question.

lines.name: ZAC
