lines.text: I said 5,000 subs, not my dignity and everything. I will put on the damn outfit at 5,000. That's all I have to offer. I'm already still working on a damn music video, so all I have left to offer is my dignity and every ounce of pride I have in anything.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So if we somehow get to 5,000 subscribers, we get an eight-foot Trinket and Pengulord gets to rule the stream tomorrow. We'll be back in about five, ten minutes, guys, please stick around, we have more interesting things to see.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: [dramatic music]

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Also ale!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: As she hiked down the mountain towards Stillben, she meditated on the task ahead. Part of the Aramente is proving yourself a strong warrior, a valiant protector, and a wise and compassionate leader. With this knowledge, one thought plays on repeat in her mind: Is she even worthy?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Then one night, Percy had a dream. A roaring cloud of smoke offered him vengeance against those who destroyed his family. When he awoke, Percy began to design his first gun. (gunshot)

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Gripping her holy symbol in one hand and her morningstar in the other, this time, Pike is ready.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Count on Scanlan for a hearty laugh, a rollicking song, and a twinkle in his eye that melts hearts and makes the females swoon.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Some may describe me as buffoonish, but I say poppycock to all that. I am much sharper than most give me credit for. I just don't pay attention to things sometimes. I've also been known to be rather cunning, loyal, happy-go-lucky, and well, dangerous. I can't help but show my true scales every now and then. But overall, I think I'm quite friendly for a dragonborn!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Along with twin sister Vex'ahlia, Vax was born by a chance encounter between elven royalty and human peasantry. Raised by their mother in their early years, the twins were eventually sent off to their father in the elven capital of Syngorn. But their cool reception among the elves--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Welcome back, guys. All right, so we had a little break here. Remember to follow our awesome artists on the Twitter. So, let's go ahead and get back to the game so we can-- we have a lot to do tonight. All right. As morning comes to, the rest of you wake up, the first thought, of course, being the heartache for your friend Grog, who is not in any of the rooms.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The heartache for our lost money.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, more the money probably for Vex-- but as you wake up, Grog is nowhere to be found in your rooms, of course. He wandered off to presumably the third floor.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is that a euphemism?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It can be.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm still in Minxie form. I slept in Minxie form. I'm going to go look for him, see if I can find him in any of the rooms on the third floor.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. A giant white saber-toothed tiger wandering the interior does set off a few minds. I mean, an armored bear being escorted is one thing, but a lone saber-toothed tiger? As soon as you make your way through the hallway, you can see one of the patrons comes out of the room and goes, (startled sound) and goes and pulls his blade out, like, "Help! Help, there's a tiger! "There's a tiger in the inn!"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Why does this always happen to me?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Come on, Snibbles, come on. We've got to go back downstairs.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Hey, keep that thing on a leash, sir."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm really sorry.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Liable to kill someone!"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Chews through her rope all the time. Come on, Snibbles.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I roll over on my back, and I'm like those cats you see on YouTube who hate being on leashes. Just dragging.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I start going, on the tummy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Goes back in his room and closes the door.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm pretty sure you just groped her.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At about this time, you hear a heavy footfall. A second heavy footfall. A third heavy footfall. And from around the corner of the staircase, descending from the third floor, you see a very hungover and expressionless Grog squinting and making his way down.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Morning, big guy. Have fun last night?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: God. You're not going to puke, are you?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You hear (meowing).

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I never puke.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you need some breakfast or ale?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What, food? I think I'm good.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I think you need an ale.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Little hair of the dog? Yeah?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Now that sounds like a plan.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys head down. The rest of you manage to eventually wake and make your way down to the tavern, where Grog is already in the process of consuming his liquid breakfast.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Hold on, I haven't come out of the room yet, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not until you want to.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: So I do, I see Grog going there, drinking his thing, I use my Mage Hand and I whack the ale out of his hand.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Your tankard goes flying out of your hand, on the ground, it spills across the front--

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I make my way down to the thing and I tell the bartender, give this warrior water. This might be your problem, Grog. You lost for a reason, and you're a warrior.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Yes, I know that, Vax. I'm just saying.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And you are what you eat.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I cast Invisibility.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Tiberius vanishes. The barkeep hands over a big mug of clear water and sets it in front of Grog.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, this is the very special beer.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It's the water that was requested by your friend. Who disappeared."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Water?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It'll get you super drunk.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Can you feel it? You can feel it, right? You can totally feel it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Keep it coming.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Meals are ordered, you guys are fed as per your purchase of the evening's inn stay. Your meal's still covered by the tavern. Eventually, you find yourselves full and about, I'll say roughly ten, 11 in the morning it would be.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm no longer Minxie to eat breakfast with my friends.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hi, good to see you, Keyleth.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Are you a dwarf again?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No. I should to talk to more dwarves before I try to... yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That was a little racist.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It was a little racist.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Remind me, what was on our plate? What's on our plate?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, we have multiple things we can be doing. We can go meet Keyleth's druid family in the mountains, right? Fire, brimstone, stuff like that. We have a lot of money waiting for us.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I think we have to go back on the airship to go get it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: In Kraghammer, yes, but there is 25,000 gold waiting for us, so that's always an option.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The Braving Grounds, we could see if they need any-- since we-- I lost us a lot of (tearing up) money.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Here, Grog. Have some clear beer.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Some more? Okay. We can see if they need anyone for hire, go and have a... (tearing up again) being strong.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I would feel it very hard to leave Pike behind in the city. Are we really going to leave and go to Kraghammer?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, we don't have to. I don't want to go yet. We traveled several days here. While we're in this side of the country, I should probably go, you know. Do the things I was set out to do.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Plus we have the poo cell phone.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Good job, Scanlan.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's more of a poo walkie-talkie.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't know what either of those things are.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Just know that there's poo involved.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Does the poop talk like my earring? Because that I understand.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes, it's like a poop earring.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's like a poop earring. Why didn't you say that in the first place? You talk through it? You talk to poo?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You see through it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hashtag poop earring.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So yes. There's multiple things.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, multiple things. There's just go back to Kraghammer and get money, or go where Keyleth wants to go.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We can look for work here, we can go back to Bahamut, see if they want--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Keyleth's got family. We can visit her family.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's what I'm talking about, yes. Fire, brimstone, volcanoes. Druids.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Keyleth, do you have an opinion?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I mean... I guess if you guys don't have anything else to do, yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How far are they from here?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm not sure. We'd have to start asking around. They're remote. We're secluded people.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Secrety.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I haven't talked to them in a long time, so I hope they're nice. And I'm sure they're--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Family stuff can be tricky.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It seems a shame to have a family and not take advantage of it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What's family for other to take advantage of?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: To hit. To kiss.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: To kiss? You kiss your family?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, I'm a goliath. What about it?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That water has a good effect on him.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Do you feel drawn to your parents, though? Do you want to go?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I have to go. I don't have a choice.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Then we should go.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. I just don't want to inconvenience anybody.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Inconvenience, schminconvenience.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, is that Dwarvish?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes. It's actually Underdark. I'm fluent.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh wait, that was Dwarvish? Inconschmenience.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Your accent's amazing.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm trying to work on learning more Dwarvish. Okay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I have a question for you, Vax. The Braving Grounds that are here, would it be to our benefit to collect maybe some coin and practice our (gets choked up) fighting before we go to the maybe-friendly fire jugglers' village?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You want to go back in there? It's awfully fresh.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Not in the Crucible, to the Braving Grounds.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The Braving Grounds. We were just in the pub. I mean, that was just a backyard brawl, basically. He's talking about going to the temple.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Was that the Crucible I was in?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The Crucible was the pit you were in. The temple you were at is the Trial Forge. The whole area you guys are in, this district of Vasselheim, is known as the Braving Grounds.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You need some time away from it. We should absolutely come back and you should break that guy's fucking face, no question.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (choked up) I could've. Totally could've.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You almost did.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah. Next time, bite his nose off right away before it's concave.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I saved it for too late. I did it too late. But then in the balls...

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The balls-- good effort.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: She needs to see where that road lies.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We should take care of each other.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And once we do, we'll come back and fucking kill that guy.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And we can use weapons if they suck, right?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Speaking of weapons, aren't we in a perfect weapons-buying district?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is that true?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yes! Can we go find an armory or somewhere that sells pointy things?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can certainly try. Yeah. As a note, too, as you're having this conversation, you reach into your pocket, Grog. As you're feeling around in your pocket, you realize that you saved in your drunken state the upper lip. It's rubbery and dry, but it's there.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: One little part of it just flapping out.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What about your beard? Is he growing his beard?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, it is a new day.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You get to go ahead and roll a percentage dice.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nine, 90.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 99. No beard this morning. It goes the other way.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It goes the other way?!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Lower percentage.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: My life is shit! I can't do anything!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's a rough day for Grog.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm hanging myself. Where's the bridge?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: There's no bridge here.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Actually, I don't know about anybody else, but I'm incredibly low on funds at the moment.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Perhaps shopping is not the best path.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We did just do a lot of shopping.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, let's go adventuring.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We haven't had an awkward parental confrontation in what feels like months.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. You guys, I'm so nervous.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You really are?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, I mean, it's a big thing.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Have you seen them, ever?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The first time I left home was when I met up with you guys.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The rest of the tavern looks around, confused. A couple of individuals step outside to look.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I'm at the dock, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You've been walking away for a while, and you get about roughly ten minutes away before you hear this impact and these horns going off in the distance.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I turn to the barkeep and say, well, what was that? Do you know? Have you heard that before? What is that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It's the horn of the Trial. Means there's some sort of attack."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Attack? Where? How do we know where?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I don't know, but I'm getting ready." And he starts going to the back room.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Getting ready where? What are we doing?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I'm going to cast Fly on myself and see what's going on.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so you become visible and begin lifting up into the air--

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: No, I'm still invisible for a round.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, because the-- okay. So you lift into the air and then appear as the concentration spell wears off. You got your crown. Looking over, you can see immediately there appears to be some commotion, like some dust has scattered up from the forest on the far side of the Braving Grounds, outside of the major wall of the city.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I'm going to do a (whoosh) to where they are.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, you start gliding over. As you guys rush out, you can see now a bunch of the Bastions that are set across the top of the wall are gathering and loading in bolts, and you see two of them fire. You hear this now guttural roaring sound, but multiple ones, like a chorus of large bestial screams echo and then (wham) a second slamming sound of stone into stone, and you can see at the very distant wall, right below where those two Bastions would have fired those giant dragon-headed bolt-throwers, both get thrown off the top, falling a good 40 feet out of view beyond the distant rooftops. You can see a small crack beginning to form at the top of the wall. Two other Bastions now begin to rush in and take the place of those two bolt-throwers.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I yank two daggers out, flip them, catch them, and just start running.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I grab the flying carpet out of the Bag of Holding before you take off?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're gliding in.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm ambling behind them.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I'm going to where the attack is, not to them.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to hop on the carpet with you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm going.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I swing down and pick up my brother.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm hopping on, as well.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You hop on.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Come along, Percival.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At which point, two more bolts are let loose, and you hear the creature once again scream (screech) in pain, and then the footfalls.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We don't see them yet?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, you just hear it. It's on the other side of the wall. You see what looks like a toothy maw streak across the top of the tower for a moment, and then the tree line shift, and the footfalls get quieter and quieter.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Go ask one of the Bastion guys what it was.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, we fly up next to one of the shooter guys and say, what was it? What is it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They're currently being tended to. One of them looks unconscious and rough from the impact of the fall, the other one's walking with a limp, trying to find its way back towards the interior of the wall that leads up to the top of his post. The one you come by has sweat beading down his face and you see he's loaded another bolt and he's looking out, wide-eyed, towards the forest. He goes, "It came back."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What came back?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "We've had this blasted thing seen on and off again for the past few weeks. Maybe it's "hungry or it's bored, but either way, this multi-headed thing, this hydra-like creature keeps "coming in and I don't know, I think it's testing the wall."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Like a raptor.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: They remember.

lines.name: LAURA, LIAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Should we go kill it?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't see it anymore. I think it's gone back into the woods.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It's fled. Got a few hits in, but it went and... we can never seem to get enough to take it down."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How frequently are these attacks coming?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Of course we can track it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I mean, you're welcome to try. It's only been maybe two or three times this past week, but "it's come once or twice a week for the past month, hitting different areas of the city. Not just this "beast, a few different ones, but mostly this abomination. It's a nuisance more than anything, "although it did get a good hit on the wall." And he looks over and you can see there's a crack in the stone. He looks nervously over it and, "I'll get to fixing that right quick. It keeps slinking "off back into the Vesper Timberlands. Kord help us if there's more than one of these."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Kord help us. Good old Kord. Okay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I grab my earring and I say, Tiberius, where are you?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I'm flying around.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You just now glide over, seeing the flying carpet towards the top of the wall.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I'm above you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Where?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Here!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Percy, Vex, and Vax, you're up on the flying carpet currently, conversing with the Bastion.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can we float up a little bit and see if we can see movement in the trees where it is?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You glance over and you can see the canopy shifting slightly. It's about a quarter-mile off and disappearing before it's eventually a little bit out of sight. You figure a creature that large can't be too difficult to track.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Go kill it?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, here's the thing. I bring the carpet back down and say, I see where it went, if you guys want to fight it. What do you think?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I'd like to go get my money at Kraghammer.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I thought we'd decided to go to Keyleth's.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The individuals are now, they're currently--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You left during the family meeting.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That money's not going anywhere.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I suppose you're right.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Let's help the city out, then we'll go on to see Keyleth's parents.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Help the city out by going to track the hydra first?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I run back to the tavern real fast. People have left, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, there are people outside looking at what happened.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Barkeep still there?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He's there, and he's currently putting on armor by himself.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Might think about leaving. Before you do, the Siren. Where might I find her?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He thinks to himself, says, "She's a slippery one. She only shows up when she wants to "start a fight. I gather your best bet would be to ask around. I hear she runs at times with the-- "what are they called? The Slayer's Take. The Slayer's Take." As you guys are talking about this, the Bastion that was talking to you guys is now coming down the wall, and he's like, "Are you "seriously thinking about going after that thing?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Only if there's money involved.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh, I can guarantee a beast of that size and that much of a problem's got a hell of a price "on its head."

lines.name: LAURA, SAM
lines.text: From who? (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I gather anyone you take it to at that point. Probably take just one or more of its heads "back, or some proof it's dead, and I'm sure there will be a few people that will fight hand over "fist to pay for that."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We could easily get a head. Let's go right now. Grog's doing something. Let's go.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Hey, Grog. Grog, come in. We're going to go kill something. We need you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Scanlan's riding on an eagle.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I can try a Locate Creature spell.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You can do a what?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I can cast Locate Creature.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: She can cast Locate Creature.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let's leave Trinket behind. Just for now, it's so hard to keep track of Trinket, Jesus.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Grog's been fighting for a long time, he needs rest. Let's go!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Trinket is there behind you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Polymorph him, please.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I didn't learn Polymorph. You're going to have to ask Scanlan about that one.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Scanlan, please. Polymorph him.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What, me? Do I know Polymorph?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We're losing time.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We can track him. I'm a ranger.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I drop to my knees and I cast Locate Creature.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I can only come if Tiberius lets me.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, to fly.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes, exactly. Let's keep twiddling our thumbs.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I'm going to cast Fly out of my ring on Grog.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Grog.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I guess we're going. Hold on!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do you want to use your ranger tracking skills, or should I try and cast the spell?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I can definitely use my ranger skills.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I'm going to cast it at 5th level, and I'm going to cast it on myself, I'll keep it on him, Grog, and Trinket.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So Trinket once again-- (distressed bear noises)

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Like last time, remember, Trinket?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Trinket seems to be a little less perturbed by the circumstance.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I grab Trinket's paw like in Superman 1, and we fly.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Grog and Trinket, coasting through the air, arm in paw.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Thank you, Tiberius.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Peter Pan and Wendy.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Can you read my mind?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. So as you guys all drift up over the town, you can immediately see the Bastion that was talking to you is looking very, very curiously at Tiberius.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, don't worry, he's really nice!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you guys vanish over the wall, you can now see before you the entirety of the Vesper Timberlands.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Most people just say thank you! Dick.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Below you, the landscape is entirely consumed by what looks like the densest forest you've ever encountered. The cold air seems to be growing colder as the day progresses on and the clouds themselves are choked dark grey. The rain never fell last night, but the storms seem, or at least the storm front that seems to push its way is still ominously looking overhead the entirety of this landscape. Looking down across the Vesper Timberland, you can see the thick canopy, the occasional mountain or hill that's jutting through the top of it, but there is no movement. There is no current sign of the creature.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Let's use some bait.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wait no, we saw the direction it went in, right?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Don't worry, my sister's a ranger. She can track anything.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Why are you being an asshole to me today?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't know, why am I?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I judged him, apparently, but I don't remember doing it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The Critters will figure it out.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, can I go low to the ground and track it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The rest of you guys who are flying coming along, as well?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm coming along.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You all come down behind the carpet, eventually breaking through the top of the canopy and reaching the interior of the Vesper Timberland itself.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: This is my other favored terrain.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Good to know. This forest, incredibly lush, presses up against the city walls itself, nearly oppressively with the impact. It grows up right against the city wall. And it's almost like the wall itself is constantly keeping it at bay in the way that the growth that's pushing inward. The tree trunks you see, now that you've hit the interior, vary in size, some only a few feet in diameter. You come across a couple that are 20, 30 feet or more, giant trees. Also, even though it's midday at this point in time, the light into the forest is choked so thin it's almost like it's dusk, near dark, inside the forest. The air hits you with the smell of wet earth, moss. Vines and branches dangle from and reach from every direction, and you can see there are, you can walk through the path here, but nearing trees themselves, the roots are so large and so twisted where they enter the ground. You're definitely going to have to keep up with your ranger friend here.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Just like the old days.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Now we've touched down and we're traveling?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys are in the forest pushing through various walkways. Go ahead and make a survival check with advantage.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Survival check? Is that for her?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yep. She's tracking the creature.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, natural 20! (cheering)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Following its path, you see that there are tracks going both ways, meaning the creature as it came through towards the city, it turned its path about and then exited the same pathway. So as you're following it along for a good 15 minutes or so, you come across a small opening in the forest where you can see what looks to be a very messily partially devoured carcass of something.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is it big?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It looks like it was pretty big, it's definitely spread out over this area.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I think it ate something here, you guys.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Good ranging.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'd like to try and identify the animal that it ate.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an investigation check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 13? You look at it, it appears to be some sort of furred beast. Huge in size at one point, it is long-dead for at least--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Like moose-big or bigger?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, as big as some of the umber hulks you've fought. But it looks humanoid-ish, more primate-like. The more you look at it, it looks like it may have been at one point a large, massive ape of some kind. But it has been torn open, limbs scattered all across this small clearing. You can see there are a series of bite and scratch marks across it, and most of its internal organs are missing.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't know what we're tracking, but I think it's friendly.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I do a nature check to see if I can figure anything out about the nature of the attack?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's going to be 21.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There are gash marks and slashes. And the more and more you inspect the body, you can see the blood that has been scattered about by this was thick and congealed by the time that it was tossed amongst this opening.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Does it look like the wounds from the weapons happened post-mortem? Or at the same time?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Actually, the wounds from the weapons appear to have occurred fresh, whereas the wounds from being killed and eaten, or being eaten by the creature, appear to be post-mortem by quite some time.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So it was killed by civilized folks and then torn apart by this thing.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Maybe the Slayer's Take.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I figure out what kind, was it some bird creature? Is all Percy could--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Ape creature. It's essentially a massive, for lack of a better term, a dire-sized ape.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Dire-ape. It's possible somebody was feeding it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Should we continue on, keep tracking?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: My sister and I are going to check and see if there's any sign of it in the area.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, perception check around. Oh, that looks good.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes, it was. 21 for me.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's way better! 25.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 25. Looking ahead, this carcass was eaten before the creature attacked the city. You can see from the time difference that this happened. But it has torn through this space recently. You can see part of the body has been shoved aside and crushed under some giant clawed foot. It continues weaving between the trees in this small pathway that looks well-worn, like there are some portions of the forest that are well-overgrown and mostly untouched. There is a specific path along the floor of this forest that looks like it's been used often by large footsteps and small ones.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Should we follow along that path? But maybe off to the side a bit, like in the trees but next to the path?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, let's just go down the middle. What, did it leave traps? It's a hydra.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'll go down in the bushes, thanks.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Is it like a thicket? Is this rough terrain we're going through?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There are many portions of this that come across as rough terrain. At certain times it's okay, especially on the worn path, any off that can be a little more difficult to traverse.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Is it plant life?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Occasional rocks or natural formations that are jutting out of the earth.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let's continue on as fast as possible.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make another tracking check, with advantage.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh man, another one?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (singing) Advantage.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm going to inspire her with a little song of inspiration. (singing) And the ranger's going to range, range, range, range, range. And the tracker's going to track, track, track, track, track. I'm just going to watch, watch, watch, watch, watch. Watch her range.

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: (singing) Watch her range.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What do I need to add?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A d10.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, so 19.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh good. Three points.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. You continue moving forward off the track for another ten minutes or so before you see some movement ahead.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Perception?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Perception check.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll join in that. 21.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: How far away are we from each other?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys are keeping a pretty close view, you're a little behind them, but you're letting them push forward unless you choose to do anything otherwise.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm going stealth.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Make a stealth check. You and Percy go ahead and you look forward, and you notice there are a couple small pools of water that have just coalesced through the recent storms or just a natural small pool of water that exists in this portion, but you can see the back of a large, scaled creature with a tan dark-brown hide, long tail, currently stooped down and drinking from the waters in the pool. You can hear the distant (lapping) sound of water dripping out of its jaws, and you can see now, there are multiple heads taking drinks out of this pool here.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is the foliage around us green? Brown? Standard foliage color?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: In this area, because of the nature of the rich earth, most of the foliage here is a deep green.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm going to turn us all deep green. With Seeming.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: With what now?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Seeming. Yes with Seeming. I spread my Seeming all over us, turning us green. With Seeming all over us.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There's nothing you can't ruin.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As the hue of your garments begin to shift to the color of the surrounding forest, I'd like everybody to make a stealth check who hasn't already, with advantage.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I cast Stoneskin right now.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're rolling for stealth? With advantage?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Natural 20!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: 25 total.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: These are trees. There, looming at the edge of the water--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Whoa. Is that a dragon?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That is a massive hydra.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So it's not technically in the dragon school?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No. It is considered a monstrosity, technically. You guys are all hidden off to the side here.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm scooting forward quietly.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Hail, hydra.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Where do you hail from, hydra?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, we'll put that as your guys' current placement. Stealth scores are?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It was a natural 20. Do I add anything?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, you don't have to worry about that.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So we're all good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Another head will come up and snap at it, and snap back, and then both go down and they start drinking on their own. You apparently are not currently noticed.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Should I have rolled for Trinket?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and roll for Trinket.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I rolled an 18 for Trinket.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So what would you like to do?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm pulling out my Dagger of Venom.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Set a really good trap. Let's think about this.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I can box him in with my Wall of Stone.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I can cast the spike-growth thing again.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Should we try to push him in the water?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We could lightning the water.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: In the water, then lightning the water? That's good.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I have all kinds of things.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Suggestions?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: If you box it in, we can't get inside.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: If we can nudge it into where he's drinking, then box him in.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Drown him?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Or lightning the water?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah. Box him in the water and then lightning the water.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Keyleth, you're up.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It would still box him in. I could just traverse it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Does that make sense? Auditorium?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let's do this.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. The wall of stone has to be connected to itself, so it would have to be like--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, I'll do a spiral. Like a spiraly ramp that traps him in.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're going to take the carpet and make our way to the other pond.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you want to go from either side? You take the carpet, go to the other side, and I'll walk over with Trinket to the other. What is he looking for?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Our carpet got moved. We have flying carpets from fans here I want to use, but it got moved.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Are they in our magic box?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We'll find them. We've got carpets from you guys to use. We'll get that in just a second. It's fine. We've got to move. So Percy?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I have the carpet, I'm going to head towards that small--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have the laser pointer. Show me.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What is that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That is a rock.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to move just to the other side of that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, you coast through here, unseen.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to do the same to the other side, actually.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Around and behind to this side, here?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Would I be able to shoot him from behind the one further back?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: From here, right now? No.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: There, yeah. Totally hidden!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes. Anyone else, placement?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm going to move closer.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Right there.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hey, Matt? Instead of Wall of Stone, I'm actually going to cast my one 6th-level spell, which is Move Earth.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Have you read Move Earth?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah. A few weeks ago.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can move large chunks of earth over a small period of time. It's not an attack spell, it's more of you can dig a cave.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Never mind. I'll stick with the original plan. I can't dome him up and go ahead and push him in the water really quick at this point?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Probably not with that one.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right, I'll stick with Wall of Stone, which I know I can do. Make a hydra pyramid!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I rolled a 30. I want to get down in a crouch and just run right there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Keyleth, where are you going? To have line of sight on the creature, where are you going?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Right there is fine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You don't have line of sight on the creature. There's a tree blocking.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh. No, let me move towards Scanlan.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so over here?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yep.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I'd like to do an investigation on his-- oh yes! I rolled a 21.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What are you trying to do?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Guess how much he weighs.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A creature of this size, probably close to two tons. More than three tons, maybe? 5,000 pounds.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Damn it. Too big.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's a big creature. Grog, where are you going?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm going to post up on, where's my laser pointer?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: In your eye! God, you're having the worst day!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Just headbutt a tree or something.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Tiberius, you're staying right there?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Keeping within 100 feet of it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, that's well within a hundred feet.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Well, Vax can move. Is that my best POV?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: To see it, yeah. Otherwise, you would be blocked.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Actually, we can move anywhere right now, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, is everyone set? Who's taking first initiative on this?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I am.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can you move Trinket next to Grog?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Trinket moves around next to Grog.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, I want to try and do a little pushy-shovery at the same time.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. There you are.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: There we go, look at us all. Strategized.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, that's going to come in handy when he just kills all of us in one shot.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. As he gets in that corner of that puddle, I'm going to Fibonacci circle and starting here, push him in a bit and wrap him up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so you create from the earth a wall of stone that comes jutting out. That way?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, I want him to be tight in the circle here, and if I can get it to push him towards the water.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The force of the wall of stone slams into him and through the physical form, it's not enough to actually move a creature of its size and weight, but it does form around it and hold it in place, currently.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: As soon as Vax sees that, he starts running through the grass, up the slope of the stone.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's currently surrounded by a ramp of stone. The heads start reaching out and biting at the stone.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: You're running up the stone?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, and I'm clicking one boot against the other as I run up it, so I'm going faster, run up, and I'm going to jump and I'm going to start stabbing into that head.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty. Go for it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay, 17. Shit. And 27.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Second one hits.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The final one hits?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh sorry, the first one was?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: 17. One.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: One misses, the final one hits, yes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And the poison is DC 15.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: DC 15. Misses. Does not make its save.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's just the first attack that hits. And then I take my keen dagger and I jab for the eye, and that is a ten of damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nice. It is considered a sneak attack because this is a surprise round.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Both attacks?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The first attack that hits is considered a sneak attack.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: First attack I gave you was sneak attack.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You missed, missed, and then you hit.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, I thought I hit and missed and hit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Missed, missed, and hit.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All right, well then erase the first numbers I told you. It's just ten plus-- it was 17, so 27.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. 27 damage. You leap, run up the stonework, click the heels, rush down and then slam, and the dagger slips into the front of its torso, the actual blade pulsing as the magical energy expels itself, the poison rocketing through its body. All of a sudden, the heads turn around and now you have five heads looking at you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Add 15 of poison to that. Add 15 of poison.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Awesome. Is he poisoned? Or just takes 15 additional points of damage?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It gets poisoned, and it takes damage on the first hit and every round I think it takes that poison.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, it just means it's poisoned, which means it has disadvantage.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, yes. DC 15, plus damage on the hit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (cheering)

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Is any part of the creature still in the water?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: One of its feet is currently off to the side in the water.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Cool. I'm going to cast Invisibility. And I can see it, because I'm on the other side of the ramp, right? I'm going to cast Chain Lightning right at the foot.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Chain Lightning? You have Chain Lightning?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's new.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Yes, it is. It's a 150 foot range, and I do 10d8 damage.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I know, I used it at the fight that you didn't want to fight in.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, what's the DC?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 17. All right, it does make its save, so half damage.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: How do I count these? There's a bunch of sevens. Stupid ones.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: All together?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, that's 28.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 43. Awesome. So a total of 22 points of damage from a save. So as it's stepping into the water, it takes an additional, I'll say, additional 2d8 from being in the water. I'll roll them here. Additional nine damage to that. As it pulls back, the stone around it, the rogue leaps up and slams it with a blade, its heads turn around, and as it does, you turn around, vanish from sight, and then... you cast Greater Invisibility or just Invisibility?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Greater.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Release your hands and a torrent of blue electrical energy rockets forth from your hands, streaking out, some parts leaving arcs that hit the nearby forests and then slamming into its body, its exposed heads. You can see the arcs now shooting through between the various necks and bodies. It writhes and streaks about, slamming its body into part of the stone that cracks and heaves from the impact, still holding it in place. Well done. You want to move, or is that your turn?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I'm going, what are the big lumps, are those trees?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: These are trees. Anywhere walking on the trunk around it is difficult terrain, you cannot pass.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I'm just going to go right behind that tree.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. That ends your turn. Who else wants to do anything this round?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I want to shoot him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You all get a free round, and then we roll initiative.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, I'm going to cast Hunter's Mark on it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hunter's Mark on it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Assassinate, on any attack before the enemy's had a chance to take a turn yet, any hit on surprise is a crit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Good to know, so that's 54 damage from your initial strike.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Thank you. That's all I get. That's all I do.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So I'm going to cast Hail of Thorns at 3rd level. I'm going to roll for that. Jesus. That's only 16. That doesn't hit, does it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: For Hail of Thorns? 16 does not hit, unfortunately.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Even though he's trapped?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, it's against the armor. It actually ricochets off the hide of the creature and disappears. It explodes against a tree trunk in the distance, and you can see a smattering of magical thorns shoot out into one of the canopies.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And that is 17.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hail of Thorns is an action to cast, though, isn't it? You've already used your bonus action to cast Hunter's Mark.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Then never mind, I don't do anything. I just fucking fucked that up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's okay, it's a surprise round. Do you want to do anything with your self-placement or Trinket-wise?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, I want to climb a tree that I'm next to.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Using your movement. Go ahead and make, we'll say an athletics check to climb the tree.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What was that, athletics or acrobatics?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Athletics.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Why?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Because there's no branches nearby, you have to--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Six! I'm going to stay on the ground.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Trinket, anything?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Trinket's going to stay right there.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll move and do Lightning. Why not? Just try to get as much as possible. Just so I won't hit whoever that is.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That would probably be right there. All right, so you unleash a Lightning Bolt?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes, I do.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and roll damage, 8d6. Does not make its save. Rolled a five.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: By the way, we need seven more subs, which is ironically the same number of heads the hydra has.

lines.name: TALIESIN, MARISHA, ORION
lines.text: Seven more subs?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Seven more subs?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're going to get a bear!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, gotcha. That was the total 8d6?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That was 6d6.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 8d6 for Lightning Bolt. Roll two more.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ten more!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, 29. You turn around the corner, the energy still crackling around it from the Chain Lightning. You unleash your own Lightning Bolt that hits it from the side, slamming into the side of one of the heads. The head actually pops from the impact. It's now got four heads.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, hey. I got a head!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What's my distance? Is this Pepperbox distance or Bad News distance, at the moment?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right now, you can't see because there's a tree in the way, but you're Pepperbox distance from here. You could try Bad News, but you'd have to set up in place.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: All right, I'm going to start curling around the tree I'm near. I'm going to take some movement to fly over the pond back here. And while I'm making my little round, I'm going to take two shots with the Pepperbox.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so as the carpet's gliding past, you're basically strafing it and (gunshots). Go ahead and fire.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You have a bear.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: She has a bear? We got a bear!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh my god, there's going to be a giant Trinket. That's so stupid.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Full-on misfire. (cackles) Yeah, I misfire. I don't care; we got a bear.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. We got a bear. As you strafe past, you pull your Pepperbox and go to fire. Suddenly there's a dull sound, and as you look at your gun, it explodes for a second in your face. You barely manage to get your visage out of the way as the barrel itself is heated up and you have to shake it off. Yeah, your Pepperbox is looking a bit rough right now.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's fine; I'm putting it away.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So everyone else has gone but Grog.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Me? Can I run all the way up and try and pull a Vax, like he did?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Hey, I want to try that! And I rage as I attack it!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, as you rush up, axe in your hand, you rush up the side of the stone ramp that she's created and it's right in slamming distance. Go ahead.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I swing away. 24.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 24 hits.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yes, and the second. 16.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 16, no. 16 misses. And then?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yes. 17.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 17 points of damage as you hack once again, slamming into the side of one of the necks, causing a gout of purplish blood to spray over the right side of your body. That ends the combat round for the surprise round. The creature is now aware that you're definitely there. Everyone roll initiative. All right, so 25 to 20?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: 16. First good roll I've ever had.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: For initiative, yeah. 15 to ten?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Both of you guys 13. All right.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Four.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: That's what you usually get.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You got a four?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, I did.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Top of the round, Tiberius. As you start to see the head that got blown off, two heads sprout out of the--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Out of the wound.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It now has six heads.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It had five when we started!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yep. And when you blew off the head, two more grew in its place.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wait, but when Hercules defeated him, he just cut off so many that they started attacking themselves and they got tangled up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Regardless, Tiberius, it's your turn.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: It's still on the same position it was, though, right? When we started? Right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It has a sense of regeneration.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: And I go, oh no you don't. And I stick out my ring and Chain Lightning him again.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Chain Lightning is a 6th-level spell.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Yeah, I know, and I had one stored in my ring.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Your ring can only store up to a 3rd-level spell. We went over this last time. It's okay.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: No, I thought that was the Ioun Stone. We all learned something today, kids. I don't do that. Instead, fine. I'm going to cast Telekinesis once. And I'm instantly going to do quicken spell and do five sorcerer points to cast it immediately again. Cast it on one head and another head and (bashing, tying sounds). To try and wrap them all and choke them.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and roll an arcana check for the first one.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Wasn't terrible. What is that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, and for the second one?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Natural 20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can't get all the heads, but you can grab two of them, one focus for each telekinetic thing. You take both heads and (whack, whack) slam them three times into each other and then twist the necks around at the point where both of them are biting onto their own necks after they've torn into a second. For that, they're both going to take 2d8 impact damage. That's nine plus five. 14 points of impact damage to each head. Both of those heads are currently grappling each other, so they will not be able to attack on its turn.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: And then I go back against the tree. That is my turn.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Second one is going to be a 19.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. So you take... 17 and 15. 17 and 15, so 32 points of piercing damage. One of the heads snaps down on your torso and lifts you up for a second as the other grabs the side of your body, and it feels like it's about to tear you apart for a second until you manage to elbow it in the nose and manage to get free of one head and shake off the other. Grog, another head comes at you. First one comes at a 24.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Hits.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And a natural 20 for the second.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, I guess so. Phillip's a fucking douche today.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 14 points from the first one. You are raging, so it's halved to seven. The other one that is a critical, that does come to 24, so 12 points of piercing damage. All right. That ends its turn. Vex, you're up.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I see its body at all?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, you can see its body, it's pretty large, mainly just the heads are visible, the ramp is blocking the lower half of it. So you can't see its legs and its main part of its torso, but you can see the necks and the heads.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So I can't see its body.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Currently, no. It is blocked by her stone.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, I'm going to shoot towards where-- is this bad? Oh no! I'm going to shoot towards where all of the heads are joined together.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It managed to unravel itself during its turn, but it used its attacks to do so.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, down where all these heads are connected. Right here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Best you can, yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to shoot my fancy exploding arrow.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The untested?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The one that you rolled.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The one that has the little mark beside it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You pull out of your quiver the exploding arrow, which you can see it, it's heavily weighted in the front so you know you have to fire it at a slight arc against most of your arrows that you shoot. So go ahead and roll an attack on this one.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh god.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What did you roll? Are you serious? As you pull back on your bow, you go to release it, and the string ignites for a second, the arcane fire behind it that you absentmindedly trigger, and as you do you realize at the last minute, the arrow doesn't fire. You actually freak out for a second and release the bow. The arrow falls, the flame hitting the edge of it, and it explodes and detonates right in front of you. Make a reflex saving throw. Sorry, a dexterity saving throw. Oh, Pathfinder. You squeak in every now and then.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Natural 20!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Now?!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Fuck you, dice gods.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What would have been an explosively painful 38 points of damage is halved.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, we know it works.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you take 19 points of fire damage, and you're knocked prone.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Now, if only I could have attached that to a donkey, at some point.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You said 19? Jesus.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're knocked flat on your ass.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: For a year, he tried to get me to design an exploding donkey.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I did.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That was a little unfortunate. Trinket can still move and finish off the round, if you'd like. That was only one of your attacks.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All right. Can Trinket run up and fight alongside Grog? All right, he's going to do that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Trinket runs up, runs up the ramp, claws out (roars).

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Don't kill me now. Okay. I don't even know. 16.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 16 does not hit.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Cool. 19.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 19 does hit.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All right. (fake-cries) Okay. 13.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Does he get Hunter's Mark?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I would say yes, because he is your bear, I'll let that happen.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes he does! That's another five.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As Trinket runs up, one claw swings through the air, and as the head rears back, seeing this new bear that's joined the fray, reaches out and clamps onto its throat with its jaws, tearing a chunk of its flesh out.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, Trinket!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty. That brings us to Scanlan.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Punch. That's my move. Punch.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs) Good, let me open the spell real fast.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You know it. Shamone.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So go ahead and roll a d20 and add your spell attack.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Add my spell attack?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, it should be at the top of your spell page.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: This? Spell attack. 21.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 21 hits. Go ahead and roll 4d8 points of force damage as the fist slams, clocking one of the hydras in the face.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 23. And with that, you actually punch one of the heads off the hydra. It goes spinning off into the forest.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, you don't want to punch heads off.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Hey guys, I got rid of another head! Hey guys, I'm on a roll! Who still hasn't gone? Keyleth, you haven't gone?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I haven't gone and Grog hasn't gone.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, I'm going to inspire Grog with my bonus action.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, what do you inspire him with?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, I'm going to inspire him. (singing) Come on Grog, yeah, you know what I mean. It's time to rage on this hydra...

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A half-hearted d10 to you. (laughs) All right, so. As that finishes your turn. At this point, you see a series of blurs in the nearby bushes.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Blurs in the bushes!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Blurs from the bush? What?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A voice rings out, saying, "Hey! What are you doing?!" And you now see an armored individual come rushing out from behind this tree here, another armored individual rushing from there, a female with a large sword rushing from this side, another character with leather armor, and a robed female coming from behind here. "This is our mark! You're not supposed to take that from us!"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, maybe you should've fought it before we got here!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "This is against the rules, you skag!"

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Wait, what rules? We don't know the rules!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We got here first! Warcraft rules!

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I don't know what that means!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Mage moves out this way and is going to look over at you as you're getting the gun, looks over and reaches out her hand. Go ahead and make a wisdom saving throw.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh my god, for the love of-- no!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What did you roll? Say it!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: One.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Hold on. Wait no, hold on. I peek over and Counterspell.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do not have visual on her at all. The trees are in between, unfortunately. As you're on the flying carpet, you see over the shoulder. You go to get your gun-- you're trying to pull out Bad News-- and then your muscles seize and you find yourself held in place.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Hold Person. Hold Percy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The cleric character you see comes forward, holding aloft a holy symbol, and reaches up and suddenly you see the canopy above the hydra begin to glow with a bright orange light before a column of fire slams down into the ground from the heavens.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: On the hydra?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: On the hydra.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wait, what about the people that are near the hydra?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It appears to only be affecting the hydra.

lines.name: LAURA, SAM
lines.text: Ooh.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What is that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The hydra takes 48 points of damage.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Four-eight?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: While you were gone, everything happened, by the way. Everything happened.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We're apparently taking someone's bounty.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This character runs up, dressed in leather armor, hood, cloak. Runs back, pulling two longswords from underneath the cloak and swings up to strike multiple times. You can see a hawk gliding over, heading in the canopy. Does 12 points of damage with the first strike. The second one, goes to swing and hits the hide and flanks off of it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And it explodes in his face and he's knocked prone.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Percy, make a wisdom saving throw.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This is a wisdom modifier plus d20?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's whatever your wisdom save is.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Natural 20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Ones and twenties tonight. So you manage to shrug the effect, but that's your turn. Grog.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I would like to look to the woman that swung and missed and go, oh, I think you meant to do this. And I'll swing for the body of the hydra.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 24 hits.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And 20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 20 hits.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Why didn't I use the stupid dice, but that's okay. 19?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 19 damage.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And 11.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. (whack) You hit once again, almost like you're cutting down a tree. You're hitting the same mark you hit last turn, carving a large chunk of the throat out. You can now see the exposed bone underneath, and it's starting to gurgle through its hissing. You bring the axe around with the inertia on the backswing and slam it into the base of another one of the necks. As it slams into it and gets wedged in there, you have to pull it out with a giant spray of blood that actually spatters across the female tiefling, which you now see. Who, as it sprays across her, she licks it off her pointed teeth, and you can see she brings her sword up, ready to go ahead and attack it again. She's glaring at you now with a this-is-mine type expression. Vax.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All right, so am I still up on the elevated part of the stone?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You are, yes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay. First is a 28. I'll just do that. And it's a sneak attack because it's occupied with Grog, obviously. So that is a two-- this is my Keen Dagger. That's a nine plus... nine, 13, 16, 19, 24. Nine plus 24 is 33, and then the second dagger, Flametongue, nine, ten, 19.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, that does hit.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay, that's a regular old four plus six is ten, and then out comes the Venom Dagger, which has already spit its poison, and that is a 26, which also hits, and that is a four plus six is ten. So (dagger noises) down its neck.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. As you spin over and arc down onto the opposite side there, nice. Well done. I forgot to roll for-- it does resist the poison at the end of its turn, by the way. Though even with the disadvantage it still managed to hit you last turn. All right, cool, so you flip over, arc yourself down after the series of dagger blades, carving these two long, ragged wounds down the side of its body. As you hit on the opposite side, where the stonework is starting to crack a little bit from the impact and swishing about of its physical body.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Can I ask, do I have a bonus action at this point? I'm hasted, and I've done three attacks. Is there time for a bonus action? I don't know.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have an attack, bonus action attack, and then the haste attack.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay, I'm good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Keyleth.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Should I try and get these fuckers off, or should I just kill the damn thing?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Attack the hydra.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I cast Call Lightning and bring a lightning bolt right down on its head.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and roll damage.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: 21 damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 21 damage, nice. All righty. That ends the round. At the top, where the secondary head you blew off was, two more heads sprout out. It now has seven heads.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Hey guys! There's more heads for me to knock off!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hey, that's the best thing ever!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We get to keep doing it!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I bet if we keep doing it though, I mean, eventually the heads will outweigh the body and it'll just have to fall over.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Okay, well. He's 20 feet in radius himself, isn't he? Sweet! I'm going to-- oh, there's a lot of people, though. Who are they? I put my ring out and I'm going to do instantly, quicken spell, do five more SP will bring me down to one sorcerer point, and I'm going to huck two Fireballs right in the center of the hydra.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. All right.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: But you're off to the side. You're not on it. Are you on it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you're drifting over here? Oh. No, you're just aiming at it. Okay. So. Back-to-back, you used the last of the sorcerer points to fire two Fireballs that explode, one after another. Go ahead and roll damage on both of them.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: 20-- what is that?-- 29, 31, 35, 36, so that's 41.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 41 for the first one. That's almost straight sixes and fives. That's awesome.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: 34, so that's 39.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 39. Were you adding five to each of those?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I don't think you're supposed to do that for Fireball.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: It's any fire attack.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, that's right, because you have the-- never mind. You do. Yes, that's right. I need a reflex save from Grog and from you, Vax.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm going to do rogue's evasion. I'm going to use Matt Colville's die made of iron from a meteorite.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: From a meteorite?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Hopefully not die.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wait, from a meteorite?!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: To be fair, the die didn't dodge the earth.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I've rolled a 17.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is a 20-foot radius.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So everything in that area?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Everything in the area. It's done. I rolled a 17. Is that a success or a failure?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What is the, what's your spell difficulty?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Spell save? 17.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 17, so that just makes it for the first one, yes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Just makes it. For the first Fireball?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: For the first Fireball, yeah. You avoid that entirely.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Do I need to roll again? We're all going to roll again in a moment?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yep. Roll for the second one now. Because two exploded in a row.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, now. That is less.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Oh, hold on a second. Wait. I want to put a pause on this real quick.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You can't. You already did it!

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I asked the question before I cast the spell. Is the hydra itself 20-foot radius? And I got a nod, so I figured my spell--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The hydra itself, the creature, it's a 15-foot diameter.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Diameter.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A radius is from the outside of it, from the middle.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Radius is different from diameter? Okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Geometry, kids.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Well then, it's fine, I'll shift it closer--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So I succeeded the first time. I failed the second time, which means I halve whatever the damage is, which is high.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, you take 18 points of fire damage.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Grog? Two saves.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What am I rolling, sorry?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You're trying to beat 17.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, I rolled a 14, plus anything?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, you've got inspiration, friend.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, I do!

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Plus his what?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Proficiency or what?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's whatever your dex saving throw is.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh. Two. So 16, plus--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So 18 for the first one.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: 18 for the first one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 18. So you take 22 points of fire damage.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Where did all that math go from the last game?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nine.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Nine?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nine.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You can take it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, I got it. I'm all good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Here's the other side of it, though. We'll get to it in a second. Nine? You take 39 points of fire damage.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't want to say it, but Trinket's right there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh yeah. Roll a saving throw for Trinket.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, remember? I said leave Trinket behind?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, I know you said that, but he also attacked him already.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Roll a saving throw for Trinket.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Come on, Trinket die. Oh my god. Okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Don't say it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, it's good.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 17 for the first one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, that just makes it. So Trinket takes 22 fire damage. All right, and then the second one?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm eating so much sugar, compulsively, out of nerves.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's stuck in there.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh wow, it's not either, it's really on an angle.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It was really on an angle. That's unfortunate because one of them was good, and one of them sucked.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So what did you roll?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Seven.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They all of a sudden look around, dazed and frustrated.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, we just set off a nuke on the thing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The hydra, due to the fiery impact, collapses inside the stone structure.

lines.name: SAM, MARISHA
lines.text: Dead?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Dead. So how do you want to do this?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Our kill!

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Oh my god.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: With casualties.

lines.name: ORION
